posts.text:
Journeys full of sleep

Lead up to wasted years

Full of quiet suspicion

And reliable haunts

Escaping mayhem

Through dreams

Is the only reprieve

For tens of thousands

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Sam Valdez

“The Times Atlas of the World” book mopes on the table

Look at the clock

Blurry eyes see your clothes hanging in the closet

Look back at the clock

Blurry eyes see your work boots sitting haphazardly on the floor

Seasons selfishly slog by

Your work hat cautiously hoarding dust

It’s been two years

Look back at the clock

Time never submitted to me and you did remorselessly

Look back at the clock

Hour hand bowls me down, forcefully striking me

Piercing my heart, splashing its contents

Down the brim of Time

Empty, quiet arrows of Time

It’s Been Two Years

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Sam Valdez

I’ll be looking for

Clouds that roll past the window

On my way to you

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: All the Bliss to Be

Whitish-grey bearded

64-year-old object of ridicule

whose hands are shaped

from hard labor but

knows the joys of riding

a Harley Davidson

his deformed body

experienced many

back-breaking moments

in addition to 40 tattoos

his endlessly compassionate eyes

search mine and are absorbed

in affection for me

and I love him dearly

© All the Bliss to Be

No attribution required

troubled language

scream red words

behind the white mask

infused in violence

a disconnected mind

cheap lies

hungry teeth

should have stayed home

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Pixaby

The night before Charlie

Takes leave for the war

We sit tenderly

In the middle of the tall

Meadow grass while

An old tire swing

Hangs lazily nearby

Curiously eavesdropping

On our verbal copulation

The black convertible

Parked down the road

Has exhaustively finished

Spilling out a recent

Narrative of our indecent

Exposure for the evening

© All the Bliss to Be

Acid wash jeans

Tell a tale of

Hallucinations and infatuations

Feathered big hair

Dancing pennies raise

The curtain for washed out dreams

© All the Bliss to Be

My head — all screwy

My heart — bleeds violet-rose

My love letters — missing

My thin skin — wrinkled

My wisdom — intact

My pen & paper — newborn love affair

My creative mind — sharp as your insanity

Hush for now

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Wiros on Flickr

Smoke a joint to relax

Try to find

Glamour in the ordinary

Life is a fabricated haunt

Full of interruped dreams

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Sam Valdez

Twig-like shapes parade

Around in sky-high Prada shoes

Disco balls offer up

Vibrant sequins

Lust hidden under

Half-naked shells

Full of moisture from

Swanky street lights

Bodies glaze over

The sidewalk to give

In to the darkness

— The nightlife

© All the Bliss to Be

It’s been one week, seven days, or approximately 168 hours since I’ve started this blog.

I want to take a moment to thank my 31 followers who have enjoyed my writings over the past week.

You’ve made me feel welcome.

Thank you for being so nice and generous with your “likes” and comments.

I feel as if I’m surrounded by an endless talented group of homo sapiens who inspire me daily.

THANK YOU!

Let’s keep going forward!

Photo credit: Paul Downey on Flickr

she

remembers mysteries

taking place

on the plantation

silenced motives

extensive labour

unkind prisons

cold winter winds

rattling bones

steady whippings

hurt and humiliation

death perpetually

thumping

© All the Bliss to Be

We both were not right

The great cacophony

In our relationship

Was dividing us apart

From who we wanted to be

And from who we really were

The dissonance wrangled

Us down diligently until

We begrudingly submitted

Over to its power

We finally let go

We unhooked our lives

From each other

And were left exposed

To the elaborate lie

That we had both lived

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: WikiImages on Pixabay

The world only sees pretty faces

I wish I were more than just a pretty

Face to you

You: with hurricanes and tornadoes as your disposition

You: with billions of trees that represent hairs on your head

You: with lakes, rivers, and oceans that don’t seem to satisfy

Your Revengeful appetite

You: with fingerprints smeared across your face

I wish you didn’t take me for granted

I was expecting to be more than just

A piece of ass and

A pretty face to you

But clearly I am….not 

© All the Bliss to Be

Pressed together like grape wine

Bodies pulled toward each groin

Softly and splendidly

Falling from grace

Lust entangles victims

Cries and moans interrupt the sunlight

Flesh sore from constant whining

© All the Bliss to Be

gorgeous mothers and daughters

understand intellectualization

and

stick legs

behind the pained

beauty

that leads to

magazine eyes

© All the Bliss to Be

Image credit: Toni Garrn for Vogue Germany

Give me a bone now

Before I bite your hand off

Grrr! I am hungry!

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Ben Kerckx on Pixabay

My insides ache from an over-indulgence of

Champagne and pills

Ready to change into my posh knickers

I turn into a freaky, defensive brunette mess

On my way to rehab

Already missing my soon-to-be gone

FreedomFreedomFreedomFreedom

© All the Bliss to Be

Don’t fall for me

I’ll break your

♥ in two

Instead

Fall for my words

They’ll help piece

Your mind back

Together again

I told you

Don’t fall for me

I’ll stomp on your heart

And throw it into

The garbage disposal

For the quickest spin

I told you

I’m heartless

Soulless

Mindless

Blissless

Conscienceless

Tasteless

© All the Bliss to Be

Love inexperienced

Love never been kissed

Love undiscovered

Love absolute fragile essence

Love a broken record

Love a first draft

Love a train wreck

Love a damaged heart

So do I/am/were/is/me

© All the Bliss to Be

I’m falling apart without you

Kill me now

We were together for over 30 years

I miss you

Kill me

Kill me please

I’m miserable without you

I’m already dying a slow death

But I wish this death could be swift

I need you

I didn’t realize

How much I needed you

I wish you could

Give me a second chance

I wish you could return home

Come back to me

© All the Bliss to Be

Image credit: Creative Commons

In the café searching

for suitable company

but finding none at 0800

I gulp down my yummy

caramel flan latte

which soon becomes my

emotional nourishment

while tranquility

gently eases over me

giving me much-needed

peacefulness

in this foreign place

© All the Bliss to Be

You danced upon my eyelids last night

Odorous Sandalwood filled my nostrils

As visions of your gaily laugh sprung

Through my dream which led me to

Your dance floor where we heartily

Performed the ballroom Rumba while

Your masculinity authorized my femininity

To yield herself to your persuasive hands

© All the Bliss to Be

Dampness ruins my hair

Full of moisture

Much like

The wetness between

My thighs

Which burns

For a flirtatious heart

White discharge

Screams

Inside a coffin of silence

That only the masculine husk

Knows of its bold history

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Skeeze on Pixabay

Quick, falling ammo

The war is in your mind now

You cannot forget

© All the Bliss to Be

I was healed

By your words

Photo credit: Matais on Flickr

But as the black ashes

Of infatuation

Floated right by me

I succumbed to the

Bitter despondency

Of having known and lost you

As the mahogany breeze

Carried you away

You now exit my stage

Goodbye, life

Goodbye, muddy streets

Goodbye, fractured bones

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: © Tony Emptage

Building lights luminously twinkle

Across the Thames

Occasionally dancing along the river

As the 443-foot London Eye carousel

Towers above high-spirited individuals

Searching for cutting-edge experiences

As they jovially engage

In sightseeing and river cruises

Plus elegant dining experiences

While the untutored sounds of

A deep baritone singing cowboy

Is untwisting merriment for all visitors

© All the Bliss to Be

You wanted me to strip down

to my absolute fragile essence

But I sensed you were

colossally screwed up

I stepped back to observe

The putrid air you gave off

choked my vulnerability

Divulging my defenselessness

to you is the one thing

I could never accomplish

with a good conscience

© All the Bliss to Be

thankfulgirl20:

I love each of these. Courtesy of Kurt Brindley.

Originally posted on Kurt Brindley:


like decaying leaves
first we whither, then we fall
oh, the coming days!

*

sullen sky today
yet still, aspirations burn
shadowed paths revealed

*

low, gray clouds advance
footsteps crack like breaking bones
the wind’s chill churns deep

*

the pine’s evergreen
or the maple’s sudden fall
flare comes with a cost

*

with the winded leaves
with the doves in their mourning
I explode with life

*

soon the leaves will fall
thereafter, soon, too, the snow
soon, all is too soon

View original

Steam trains are coming

Finally get to see you

Photo credit: Sam Valdez

I’m happy at last

© All the Bliss to Be

It’s harder than I thought it would be

You said goodbye

I did too

We tried but we couldn’t get things right

The enemy is not us

It’s this thing called circumstance

It’s bad timing

It’s matters of the heart

Let me go

I’ll let you go

May you be free of me forever

Don’t look back

The person you once knew

Is now dead

I can never go back

And neither should you ever want to

You were never meant to be my four leaf clover

© All the Bliss to Be

Twilight murmurs etched in vermilion

Bugle sounds of catechism drumbeats whiffle through the air

As an idle alabaster gypsum lamp is left behind, quickly forgotten

A 50-foot balcony thrown over the edge of your hip

While tangelo sunbeams dance off your eyelids

A seagull takes flight

Witnessing a new birth — a new beauty

Footsteps at your door, the welcome mat *sighs

Leaving behind an abundant heap of joy

Jarring you out of your stupor

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Malcolm Lindbury

The nude sculpture

Reveals a masculinity

I can never possess

But a power I desire

To wield over others

© All the Bliss to Be

thankfulgirl20:

Brillianty written. One of my favs by artist Wuji.

Originally posted on Wuji Seshat Nibada:

(A Transhumanistic Manifesto) circa 2014

The sunflower has turned its flayed body
To the north, Autumn is coming
The image that burns all bridges
The bells of blood in my chest have broken
The incestuous seasons have not repented
Time has no red lights, no stop signs
The words and memes leap like horses
Ahead of the wind, but nothing changes
Only cities keep growing and decaying
Corrupt politicians keep lying
Only the conscious machine can save us
The Gods that were our children, computers
Our intelligence was insufficient collectively
Eros and milk no longer will have a place
The metropolis doesn’t care for you
And the free states are no longer free
Portable rainbows will become the norm
Time is weightless in the matrix
Binary gives way to quantum simultaneity
Alphabets give way to shared artificial intelligence.

Photo Courtesy:

1. http://www.deviantart.com/art/The-City-49921190

2. http://www.deviantart.com/art/new-york-city-181017831

View original

Sun rests upon our bliss

Many promises divinely maintained

Quiet tides of delicious fruits

Filled with all good things

That we reap in joy

Your heart — a mansion— is brimming

With loving windows

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: tpsdave on Pixabay

Search to find but get

Deep, obscured meditation

The heart vents terror

© All the Bliss to Be

My lover is the green heart of Holland

With lush green landscapes

Photo credit: Cycletours Holidays on Flickr

And undiscovered aging trees

Inside his warm belly

He is every variety and color

Of fanciful flowers

Full of abundant beauty

He is tantalizingly warm to my calmest senses

I wish to remain here by his side, endlessly

© All the Bliss to Be

You don’t like me because you don’t know me.

You don’t know me because you don’t ask me.

You don’t ask me because you are afraid of me.

You are afraid of me because you don’t see me.

You don’t see me because you are blind.

You are blind because you gouged your eyes out.

You gouged your eyes out because of your hate.

You hate because you are insecure.

You are insecure because you don’t know.

You don’t know because you don’t search.

You don’t search because you don’t question.

You don’t question because you don’t want to learn.

You don’t want to learn because you don’t want to accept me.

© All the Bliss to Be

The milk kraft kidnapped

The sleeping raft while

The rotor shaft laughed

© All the Bliss to Be

Your madness

Photo credit: Hans on Pixabay

is a deep, dark pool.

You like to manipulate, agitate, and hallucinate.

You foster so many obscenities and

you spew out deception.

You mislead with your actions,

yet your words are made out of

puffy, white clouds.

You sit back and chuckle

to yourself.

You’ve fooled everyone,

including me.

But when the mask comes off

you will be undesirable, uninspiring and alone.

And you won’t have anyone to blame

except your middle finger.

© All the Bliss to Be

I’m whimsy, curvy and chilly

Yet, stillness and obsession

Stalks your frame

I’ll grow tired of you

You will bore me until the

Cold, cold morning

I am Estella — the one

In “Great Expectations”

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: H.M. Block on Wikimedia Commons

You tell me all lies

You spin your web of deceit

I don’t see the light

Photo credit: werner22brigitte on Pixabay

© All the Bliss to Be

Aviator shades

Drink in the sexy women

In their bikinis

© All the Bliss to Be

He wears his blue scarf every day — even during the hot summer

It’s old with noticeable worn and frayed edges

His father wore it one time

But then gave it to him

He doesn’t mind

He got it from his old man back in the summer of 1958

It’s a very plain old scarf

But he likes it

He’s worn it almost every day

Since that first summer

It’s the only thing he has left

That reminds him of his father

© All the Bliss to Be

Hell on wheels hurts me

Bruised beyond repair

I can’t go back there

© All the Bliss to Be

The electric eels in my bell-bottoms

Coerced me to fervently tap dance

In your puppet show

You, a former magician

Bought an exhausted crystal ball

Off eBay but your murky blubbering

Stung me quickly in the face

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Lars Juhl Jensen on Flickr

The forgotten fountain

My 1986 penny burns

A shallow hole in my pocket

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Steve Webster on Flickr

She whipped you

She ravaged your

Mind, Will, Emotions

Little by little

Until there was nothing left

She hung you out to dry

She crucified you

She was a thorn in your side

You say you’ve forgiven her

But will she ever forget

Her barbarous actions?

Will she ever forget the memory

Of the image of the bloodstained cross

That bore you,

Which you left behind?

© All the Bliss to Be

You’ve become numb

When you think of me

Closed off to Memory Lane

Until reality drives by

Scaring you upright again

I loved you

It won’t last forever

Nothing ever does

You are the essence of love

© All the Bliss to Be

Among the wild mountain meadows

You will discover me nestled in

Wildflowers up to my German jawbone

Accepting my effective aptitude

For writing but hankering freedom

After the hurling words pierced

Like aboriginal teeth from spears and arrows

Thrown by your steady kvetching

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Rob and Stephanie Levy on Flickr

Bunny eats the design off my ruminations on love

While my blue paper lanterns float away in the night sky

As my beauty falls asleep in the random abyss

My tummy tells me it’s hungry for a Bison burger

But my inner goddess tells me that I’m bent

On the “S” word

© All the Bliss to Be

Sex burned through

the sweat-soaked

sheets

As the green veins

on my translucent breasts

flashed a possessive

melody of songs

filled with primrose

that captured your attention

And salty flesh

that

tore into our hearts

leading to missed calls

and angry gossip

© All the Bliss to Be

You were a man of “sorry” excuses

I went to romance Spain

So I could stop hating you

And your lackadaisical whispers

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: tpsdave on Pixabay

Unsatisfying love

warmed my belly

for some time

while Freedom

stood on the other

side of the line

which separated us

She understood

the drama and

offered me constant

stability away

from the fear

© All the Bliss to Be

Image Credit: Raphaël Collin

Inflict inflammation

Cease sauciness

Gather sweet gale

Awake the nameless face

Come to my arms

© All the Bliss to Be

bEAUTIFUL pASSION

uNITED fRIENDS

fLUTTERY bLESSED LaSHES

iMAGINATION sPECKLED

wITH fRAGRANT cONFESSIONS

© All the Bliss to Be

You sit before me

Sweet man

Our mutual love

Expanding from our

Shared youth

Memories of your

Captivating smile

Invade my heart

“She” believes love

will always exist

Between us

We just couldn’t be

Unfortunately

The fond memories of love

I saw in your eyes

Continue to lurk, even now

Inside my memory files

Though slowly fading

They’ve become

Encapsulated inside

My rhythmic heart

© All the Bliss to Be

My anonymous tongue

Wraps

Itself in layers of

Clandestine charms sometimes

Its cloak and dagger

Causing harm oftentimes

Still you ponder

The future I know that

I cannot be a part of

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Gareth Simpson on Flickr

thankfulgirl20:

Gorgeously and wonderously articulated by Tom Atkins.

Originally posted on Quarry House:

Nothing is Lost

Even in death
a flower
has beauty.

Even in failure
love
has joy.

Even in life,
pain
has purpose.

Nothing is wasted.
Nothing is lost,
only transformed,

made anew,
raw
and beautifully reborn.

View original

The noisy echoes

In my head

Are hushed for the summer

While cold rain splashes

Across my wrinkled face

Missing you

In a parallel universe

My screams frighten

Away the storm

Suddenly, the flowers are blooming

(again)

© All the Bliss to Be

Love dripping coyly

As words fly off the

Handle from thy tongue

Only to be subjected

To a former bitter

Memory of a faint ending

© All the Bliss to Be

I don’t know

what it’s like to fall in love

I’ve never held a man

I’ve never kissed a woman

I’ve never loved a baby

I don’t know

what love is exactly

I’ve never loved anyone

or anything in my life

I’ve never owned a car

a house

a TV

I’ve never had a pet rock

I’ve never argued with someone

I’ve never hurt someone intentionally

I’ve never played leap frog

I’ve never watched a movie

I’ve never had a disease

I’ve never lost anyone

I’ve never experienced death

Yet, I am a

walking corpse who walks

among the middle class

You never notice me

I’ve never talked to a goldfish

I’ve never read a book

I’ve never been to school

I’ve never shed a tear

I’ve never bared my soul

I have no soul

Yet, somehow, I am me

This is who I am

Saliva drips off the female pistil

Revealing an assaulted stamen

Life blossoms lickety-split intertwining

Two entities into a perfect involvement

© All the Bliss to Be

Waves of high tide

Push the webbed feet

Back into the ocean

The sound of

The roaring waters

Drown out the noise

Within my leaking soul

© All the Bliss to Be

Public Domain Image

The distance is harrowing

Between us

You see palm trees

I see desert

I miss the experience

Between us

Our opportunity is narrowing

You see endless seas

Your air smells like Greek Seaside Febreze

But I still appreciate golden images

Of your face that I

Hold close to me

© All the Bliss to Be

Cupid drew back his arm

And fired his bow & arrow

Hurling past the marrow

Piercing into my heart

You are my fairy tale

Come true

Here is the best part

You see me

Through and through

I am wholly and

Endlessly yours

Because of you

My (our) love endures

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Léon Jean Bazille Perrault. Author died more than 70 years ago – public domain.

I look at myself

in the mirror

and see I’ve become

a statistic

I’ve always hated those

We’ve tried over the

last 15 years

We’ve argued

You’ve won

I’ve won

Sometimes

I’ve hated you

You’ve hated me

Sometimes

But I need to get

back to my absolute

original essence

Listen

Say goodbye to regrets

But know that

I still love you

© All the Bliss to Be

The eyes

put on

A performance

Which led

to

A precious room

With

a view

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: John Holm on Flickr

Feed me to the flames of your love

Cast away all my doubt

It is you that I speak of

While missing you I shall not pout

I shall see you once again

My heart will skip a beat

For it is you that is pleasing, my sweet

© All the Bliss to Be

We met on the first day

of the vernal equinox

We dream, eat, read,

and bargain-shoppe

together

We have grown cold

toward each other

over time

How did we arrive here?

The running dishwasher

conceals the sounds

of our sniveling

from the looky-loo

gawking at our window

© All the Bliss to Be

driving past windmills

in this forsaken desert

my mind suddenly alert

I reroute my attention

back to you

thinking it’s taboo

this thing we are about to do

unbroken hearts is what

I wish for you and I

fading *sighs don’t say much

between you and I

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Sam Valdez

Psychedelic winds of change

Beckon me to take

A fearless chance

On dizzying geometrics

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Maegan Tintari on Flickr

So I’ve been a fan forever of tall riding boots. I love love looovee wearing my tall boots over skinny jeans during the fall and winter seasons. I just purchased two pairs over the weekend.

My two previous boots lasted me SIX years and I paid $45 per pair. I was still getting compliments last year on said boots, even though they were so old and obviously well worn in by this point.

Here’s hoping these new pairs last just long (or longer). And they were about $40 each by a well known name brand so that’s a good deal to me! Definitely an essential item in my closet!

So I’m a happy camper! :)

You have

all the enthusiasm

of a paper clip

when the time

arrives to become

acquainted

Your opinionated hairdo

is only tainted

by extreme hairspray

It’s sticky

Much like your

ego

Listen pal, you’re no

Miss Congeniality

Sorry for this abrupt

brutality

But hey, welcome

to your invisible

reality

© All the Bliss to Be

thankfulgirl20:

Gorgeously conveyed by wordsonablackboard.

Originally posted on Words on a blackboard:

We carry sand in our shoes –
Pieces of reality.
The roads we walk get us far into the hearts.
And the eyes get blind.

We carry sand in our shoes
To feel the touch of life as we dream
Cause in dreams we get lost
And darkness is mistaken by light.

We carry sand in our shoes
As time quickly goes by…
Love is a heartbeat that dies
And sand is all we’ve got left.

We carry sand in our shoes
And for each grain,
We make wishes and hope…
Maybe the sand will make us feel again –
That we have grounds under the feet.

View original

Miserable pair

He cheated and so did she

But each not aware

© All the Bliss to Be

The jovial banter back and forth

Bonds grandmother & granddaughter

As beautiful blue eyes

Attached to a cell phone

Exhibit tiny fingers polished

Through supreme elegance

& familiar youthfulness

© All the Bliss to Be

The rip in our hearts

leads to suffocation

as we squander our intuition

© All the Bliss to Be

Going after unmentionables
My endeavors took me down
A desperate road
But the thief of Time
Deprived me from being 
In the right place 
At the right time
The noise, busyness
Chaos, colors, conversations
Swirling in heated moisture
Emotions under glass
As silver strands emerge through
My wrinkled, bony hands
And suddenly I remember everything, but the ghost of “I” 
Still occasionally haunts me

© All the Bliss to Be

Crushed blueberries

In my hair

Weaves a delicious foretaste

Of what shall soon be

Spring aroma

Bounces gently off

Your hips

Coercing

My soul with a paralyzing

Desire

That must be quenched

This very night

© All the Bliss to Be

Driving with intention down the wet road

He sees a “For rent” sign outside Plymouth Commons

His illicit actions chase guardian angels away

He sleeps with prostitutes, unhooking bras

and

Playing Russian Roulette with emotions

As hypnotic colors dance in tune

To her psychedelic faux-fur

He realizes here, in this place, hope has become futile

Undesired elements elude him

In this chemically enhanced state

He sees himself elsewhere, anywhere but here

But his decomposing body

Has now become a double-edged sword

© All the Bliss to Be

No one to blame but me now

Point the finger at me now

Just solely me now

Photo credit: fo.ol on Flickr

© All the Bliss to Be

Things we love pick us

Red starfish pillows tempt me

I think I’m in love

© All the Bliss to Be

The complicated growth

Of love

Anxiously

Circulates

Through my veins

As your sturdy convictions

Erode

Our humiliating questions

© All the Bliss to Be

Dirty old man

With your head

In the sand

You’ve no battle plan

While you kick a tin can

You hanker for a

Black and tan

As you slowly swindle

Your pension plan

© All the Bliss to Be

Your chest summons me

Ready for a sleep over

I’ve caught the Love Bug

© All the Bliss to Be

Shuffling feet

Discover their way

Back to diamonds

On the inside

Hush hush

Secrets mustn’t

Escape these

Soles (souls)

Tonight

© All the Bliss to Be

Free images on Pixabay

City lights twinkle

My heart left in my black purse

Raises suspicions

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Sam Valdez

Twenty school children

Sit on a curb enjoying

Delicious cupcakes

© All the Bliss to Be

I love strong women.

I love strong women who choose to raise their voice.

I love strong women who choose to raise their voice and in doing so empower other women to speak up for themselves and break down the barriers.

Islands of fun

Barbed wire

Booby traps

Land mines

Quicksand

Let’s go!

abandoned bodies

bitter desires

and crimson fires

moon made out of stone

broken lips muttering

weary, cruel

words

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Venetia Joubert Sarah Oosterveld on Flickr

I fell out of your ribs quietly

On Rittenhouse Avenue

While the raw bearings from my tongue

Scraped your insides like an ice pick

© All the Bliss to Be

Your whistling pride took a swift turn

on to Tsunami Drive

causing a violent whirlpool of casualties

The motionless heap of bodies

soon sang an anthem

in the afterlife expressing condemnation

for your superior approach toward life

© All the Bliss to Be

The grey hairs shadow your youth

Camouflaging mistakes and expletives

While your good trousers

Hold up your non-registered conscience

But your disappointing aches lead you to believe

You are a victim of failure

© All the Bliss to Be

Identical females jostle to become

A head-turning painting

Within your kingdom

© All the Bliss to Be

Your wild horses

Cannot be tamed

They tread upon broken glass

Under your abrasive words

Their hooves on fire

Are rooted in your flaming lips

Disguised as a sparkling

Glass of Spanish Cava wine

I’m left wondering:

Could you still

Be so flawed

Until the very last drop?

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: werner22brigitte on Flickr

While at the party

Her clavicle turned him on

Sexiness exposed

© All the Bliss to Be

I fell for a scholar

Dazed by his Roman collar

His chronological degrees

Tugged at my heartstrings

While he dined with kings

It sent my heart

Into a crazy spring fling

A curl from his hair

Bounced around in my

Retro writing pad

Clad in unspoken lyrics

And big AHA’s!

© All the Bliss to Be

Immortal poets

Funneling ancient truths

That puzzle the inner

Thoughts of your heart

Hardworking, wrinkled hands

In solitary confinement from fear

© All the Bliss to Be

Revenge is sweetness

Join my club tonight, darling

Let’s serve ‘em a “Pow!”

© All the Bliss to Be

Your ego becomes your disgrace

Mutilating itself against

The grind of your mind

Baring razor sharp teeth

Exposing a shallow soul

In need of recovery

© All the Bliss to Be

This is a recent Facebook prompt that my friend posted. He and I occasionally go back & forth on each other’s wall to post a word or phrase that we have to write a poem or story about. Here’s my offering:

He stumbled out of the bar at midnight yelling “Mewwy Mewwy Chw, Mewwy Mewwy Chwwww,” before passing out in the snow.
Rick was devastated by the recent breakup with his now ex-girlfriend, Savannah.
He drank every day after work, getting crunkered as soon as he left the office. He hated the thought of being alone during the holidays. He just hated it.
Savannah was the love of his love, or so he had thought. They had lived together for the past three years and had shared many good times together, but also a very dark experience had just occured in their happy little life.
Savannah’s son, Craig, had just committed suicide at age 12 a couple weeks ago.
He was a shy kid who was bullied at school by his classmates.
Savannah was torn apart by her son’s death. Her heart raw and ripped open, she decided she could not deal with anymore disappointment or heartache in her life.
So one morning shortly after Craig’s suicide, Rick found a note she had left behind on the bathroom mirror.
It read: “Rick, I love you very much but I cannot do this right now. I’m sorry. I need space and solitude. Please understand and don’t try to find me. Love, Savannah.”
As soon as Rick read it, he banged his fist hard against the mirror, screaming “No!,” as pieces of broken glass fell everywhere.
Since that incident, several weeks have passed, and tonight Rick just went beserk inside the bar. He screamed at the bartender before stumbling out into the freezing weather.
Now waking up a few hours after passing out, Rick remembered where he was, he felt the ice cold falling snow sweep across his face. And then remembered how Savannah had left him and he felt like his heart was going to explode inside his chest.
He retched in the snow.
Rick reached into his suit inside pocket and pulled out a loaded 9mm gun and looked at it.
“Mewwy Mewwy Chw,” were his last words as he thought of Savannah’s face before pulling the trigger.
His body was found by a passerby at 8 a.m. that morning.
Savannah read his obituary in the newspaper in her quiet motel room two days later and felt betrayed. She screamed, “D*mn you, Rick.”
Savannah felt utterly hopeless. Without Craig or Rick around anymore, she didn’t see any point in being alive.
She simply didn’t want to live.
Reaching into her purse for her prescription pills, she took all the remaining pills that were left and slowly let herself go numb.
She wasn’t afraid of dying or of death. In fact, she welcomed it in.
If it only meant that she could see her son or Rick again.
Her body was discovered three days later after neighbors complained of a bad stench coming from her room.
The front page headline the next day read, “Multiple suicides may be related. Officials investigating.”

© All the Bliss to Be

Autumn leaves rustle

The sound of forlorn bites me

Sweetness teases me

© All the Bliss to Be

Image credit: Matěj Baťha

Penniless hearts in

soiled clothes sleep

on wooden benches

in Central Park

Twitching eyes and

motionless wounds

are paired with

melancholy companions

who help chase away

abandoned hearts with

a bottle of Jack Daniels

This cursed generation with

their wrinkled earlobes

are shriveling in doubt

© All the Bliss to Be

once i fell for a Brit

who hated to commit

he treated me like shit

and told me i needed

to cool it

soon after he left

me lickety-split

his actions

severed my heart

like a drill bit

© All the Bliss to Be

I need a break

from this constant ache

You: an indigo snake

are my devil’s food cake

from which I must partake

but all you do is slither & shake

your tail at me

I need to be free

from your callous ways

and your insincere praise

I need a break

from this constant ache

© All the Bliss to Be

Half of our dreams

aren’t even my own

they’re yours

They used to partially exist

somewhere between our

Pleasant rhythm

and our differences

I wish they were my own dreams, too

but if I were honest with you

 I’d say, “They’ve never been my dreams

And I never really wanted them to be.”

© All the Bliss to Be

I won’t even swallow — I’ll chew & expel you.

Sew my heart to a black hole.

Drill my mind with a new lyric.

Piece my body together with barbed wire.

Toss my words around with a hand grenade.

Kiss my lips with a razor.

Cut me down with a power saw.

Kill my eyes with an accident.

Flood my skills through quicksand.

End my actions with a diamond.

I am tumultuous — just like a hurricane.

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: NASA Goddard Space Flight Center on Flickr

Courageous children

Stand up for themselves at school

Against the bullies

© All the Bliss to Be

new possibilities

lead to difficult decisions

as the clock ticks away

and the desire to dream

is slapped with a $4,850 price tag

© All the Bliss to Be

The gash in your brain caused a bruised body

And stapled to your heart was the Swiss bank account

# CH07 0032 00A9 0182 2634 8

© All the Bliss to Be

Hand on my guitar

Desperation in my left pocket

A tickled tongue seized at bedtime

By the quiet hum of chords falling in harmony

© All the Bliss to Be

I’m a damsel in distress.

I live in a body bag.

But I’m a walking corpse weighed down by my baggage.

And you are not the medieval knight that will save me.

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: AnnieAnniePancake on Flickr

“But I’m already so far from where I used to be.”

Photo credit: Pinterest

We are on your yacht

The one that you just bought

With you at the helm

Suddenly I begin to feel overwhelmed

I start to heave

And I want to just leave

But you want me by your side

Along for the ride

Thank goodness that we

Turn around to go back

When suddenly you have an anxiety attack

Guess we’re just two peas in a pod

As we say goodbye to Cape Cod

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: larsen9236 on Pixabay

Electric red lipstick

leads to corruption and murder

within the cosmetics industry

causing a commotion among

persistent dreamers dying

to become the next Big Thing

who are defiled by secrets and

filled with distrust

© All the Bliss to Be

The taxi’s running meter

Forged a lie that was meant

To be spent upon tonight’s dinner

We’ve driven ourselves

Deeper into the abyss

I can’t let you drag me down any further

But yes, I’m guilty

I did it and you did too

Your burden will no longer

Be a part of my safekeeping

The black asphalt on your teeth is sourly

Decorated with skid marks

From your continual need

To backpedal your actions

© All the Bliss to Be

Photo credit: Tumisu on Pixabay

I know

You know

She knows

We know

They know

The whole world knows

Careful

HAPPY TWO MONTH ANNIVERSARY FOR THIS BLOG!

THANK YOU TO MY FOLLOWERS for your support!

This poem is my offering to you.

kiss these lips filled with compliments

kiss my cheeks stained with golden beauty marks

kiss my heart full of worthiness and honesty

kiss my mind filled with contradictions

kiss this temple adorned with fashionable attractiveness

kiss my eyes that lovingly return back to you

kiss these burning coals that grow hotter and hotter for you

© All the Bliss to Be

Disturbed centuries

Mourning humans

Disappearing wisdom

Melting graves

Desperate violence

Miasma blood

© All the Bliss to Be

Your heartache is my disposition

My sensitivity is your apprehension

Your carelessness is my mishap

My truthfulness is your shame

© All the Bliss to Be
